page.title: 04A.B.N.R FLORA & FAUNA (cont)
page.content:
include many grasses, marsh marigolds, spearmint, viper's buglass, meadowsweet, etc. A comprehensive account of all life to be found within the area of the Reserve is to be found in the The Management Plan as published by East Lothian District Council (in 1977) who administer the Reserve on behalf of the local people.
The Reserve is open to the general public at all times, though access may be denied to certain areas at specific times of the year (i.e. in the nesting season). In order to reach the Reserve visitors cross the Peffer by a long wooden footbridge (some 200 metres in length), one of the longest in the land which is under great pressure from the sea particularly at high tides in a north-west wind.
